ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: PHIL 703 was an exploration of issues surrounding the problem of evil and the doctrine of hell. I would recommend it as very interesting (if a little disorganized).

Very good course -- expanded my understanding of the Problem of Evil considerably and opened up a lo of new ways of thinking about it. Sometimes it felt like the protracted musings of Professor Keith DeRose, but he has very interesting musings, so it was all cool.
A comprehensive overview of the problem of evil and a good survey of its major philosophical contributors. Highly recommended.
The course investigates the different arguments concerning the coexistence of an OOPG and evil. I would recommend it if the person has an interest in an OOPG.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course gave me a good indication of current work being done in the field and prepared me to pursue further intensive research.
Yes. The connections to my research were somewhat tenuous as I presumed the course would engage more with natural evil.
